comment: Brilliant man & stellar course. I found his HW problems easier to understand than the textbook's. It is easy to follow his line of reasoning, both in class and in assignments/tests and the lecture notes are a fantastic resource. DO NOT TAKE IF NOT A PHYSICS MAJOR, you will have no clue what is going on, as he has very high expectations.
Avoid him. You really have to read the textbook to teach yourself because he is not really a good lecturer. His tests are really easy to fail.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Don't do it. Just don't. The highest grade on test 1 was a 75 and the average was a 36. Tests 2 & 3 were relatively easy compared to the first one. The one good thing that he did was provide the tests from previous semesters but it was still bad. If you have to take him then you will be teaching yourself.
Just terrible. He was very rude and didn't explain anything in detail.

His "lectures" are him reading formulas and questions taken out of context from the book and then moving on (you're better off just reading the book in class than listening). There are 4 tests, 3 at 20% of your grade, 1 at 25%, and HW at 15%. 1st test average was 30%, 2nd was 60%. I skipped class and had a B because I just read/study. DO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He is a world-renowned researcher who is FORCED to teach every now and then to remain a professor. He should just be a pure researcher. Due to his research prowess though, he will never get fired. It's best to just avoid him altogether. He typically has >70% of students withdraw or fail, and he simply does not care about teaching. AVOID!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Test 1 average was about 50 test 2 was around a 60. 
One student asked him why it is only his class with this high of a failure rate he said it is because the other professors do not teach physics.
The class also started with around 40 people and about a week about test 2 there were around 4 people in the class.
He is here for research nothing else

Avoid this professor at all costs. This class relies very heavily on math and he does NOT take any time to explain the concepts that are behind the formulas. For the first test that everyone in the class took, the highest grade was a 65. Every time I would ask him what to do to help me succeed in this class, he would keep saying to just get better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The first test the average was a 25%. It gets a little easier from there but the final is like you are back on test one difficulty. He only seems to care about anything other than teaching. If you do take him, go to breakout, that is your best bet to pass. I'm sure he is like most physics professors but he doesnt help make physics any easier.

Hes a brilliant physicist just a hard professor! You really have to work hard to get a good grade: take good notes and do the homework/read the book! In my opinion the homework is harder than questions he asks on the tests. Overall really enjoyed the class!
This class was ABSOLUTELY awful. If you like not having curves, extra credit, or even being considered for partial credit, take this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Im doing well in his class, but ONLY BECAUSE I TAUGHT MYSELF EVERYTHING! If you want a class with a professsor who writes equations and does not answer questions NOR explains how to apply equations, this is the one for you! If you can avoid taking him, do it at all costs, especially if you cant teach yourself this stuff. I
Great Teacher!

As many have said, brilliant physicist, horrible teacher. First day he gave assessment exams because the uni told him his fail rate was too high. There are no 'pre-tests' anymore, no kind of study guide given, just told to do the homework again (loads of homework at that). Only three tests and a final, with no curve.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you're an engineering student and learning this material is important for your major, this professor is great. If this class is required but less important for your major Professor K might not be worth the extra effort. He teaches very well and answers any question you have during breakout sessions, but he only has 4 tests that he doesnt curve.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is by far the hardest physics professor in Kennesaw. He doesn't care if his students understand the material. Overall not a good teacher in my opinion and other peoples opinions as well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: For the love of God, do not take him! If you didn't know, he is a world-renowned physicist (not exaggerating), and he is forced to teach so that he can keep his research money flowing in. So please, DO NOT take him! He only cares about his research. His tests are 3 questions (9 parts), and he doesn't curve, even if the class average is a 40. AVOID!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you are not electrical engineering, do not take him. He is a research professor, not a teaching professor. I took every AP Physics in high school, did the homework, studied for hours for the test an failed. He gave a 3 question test that was 9 parts total. The class average was a 44% and he does not curve. He does not care about your grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Kindonakis is a great professor. I recommend taking him. He's not an easy professor, he covers a lot of material, sets the bar high (for KSU at least), and naturally requires you to work hard . He's a smart guy and no doubt a good particle physicist. Take him if you want a challenge and to get a lot out of the course.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Three tests and a final. THAT'S IT. No quizzes so you don't know how you are doing before the tests, and the tests are only 3 questions. Barely any partial credit, so one question wrong and you have a bad grade. Very smart guy, but cannot get on the students level to teach properly. Flies through the material.

Took his for Phys 2211. This class is a tough class, however, this professor makes it much tougher. There are only 3 Tests (60%), Homework (10%), and the Final (30%). The tests only have 3 questions which are extremely hard.  I beg you, do not take this professor. Wait a semester if you have to. Pick ANYONE else.

Do NOT take this professor. I don't care if you have to wait a semester; it is not worth it. You will not have a good time with this guy, even if you think you are an awesome student. No study guides, just burns through formulas with very little explanation, no curve, no extra credit, easy to fail tests, and is kind of condescending.

HE DOES NOT CURVE. 4 lengthy and involved questions on each exam and his partial credit is a joke. Not allowed to bring a formula sheet. The Class average was 40 both on exams before I dropped. He has admitted to having only two people pass before. He marks homework as "ok" easy padding to your grade,but it tells you nothing useful. Avoid.
He didn't give a study guide like everyone else said and his tests averaged about four questions each, making it very easy to fail. All other opinions seem accurate. I wouldn't take him, again.

Dr. Kidonakis Completely understands the material but dose not know how to teach. He also give copious amounts of Homework which take hours to complete every week, and his tests are extremely difficult. That being said the class is a difficult one regardless, but If you do not find your self talented in physics, avoid this teacher.
nice guy. was not easy class.  real tough on grading. no curve or extra point. take him if you are science major or considering transfer

This isn't an easy class, no matter who you take it with. But he knows what he's talking about & is a great teacher. Go to class, do ALL the hw, never miss a lab & memorize the sample tests he gives you they are exactly like the tests. Great as answering questions. I couldn't be happier I took this class with him.

I had to retake this class and this professor made it very easy for the class to pass because he provides sample exams that are just like the exams. I regret not taking him the first time I took this class. He is better than any other.

If this a mandatory course you should take him. The exams are almost identical to the study guides, he only changes the numbers and this is extremely helpful. Practice problems and you will pass. Do not take LaRosa

This is not a class to take if you want an easy A. You must study and keep up! However, he's fair. His tests are almost identical to his practice exams so study the practice exams well & you can easily pass. Lots of people drop the class, but physics has a high drop rate and I don't feel this reflects on the teacher as much as the material.

Extremely smart, but extremely difficult teacher. It seemed as if he was reminding us of the material rather than teaching it, and lectures did not help. I had to read every single word of the book in order to pass.  Don't take it here if you want easy transfer credit, like I did. I really wish I took it at Tech rather than at KSU. It's that bad.

He knows the stuff but he does not know how to make other understanding.If u taking his classes make sure what a and alpha is? Probably he would be okey if he takes class for ms level. I loved physics but he is the one who changed my mind.
The guy knows his physics, there's no question. However, with 2 exams, no curve and a final you can't afford to mess up at all. Homework not mandatory. Avoid if you can.

He is a horrible professor. After the first week of classes, at least 10 people dropped out. He seems to know his information but does not know how to teach. Wont help if the information isnt taught correctly. GOOD LUCK IF YOU CHOOSE TO TAKE HIM!!!!

This teacher is HARD.  The homework's really hard and the tests are worse, but he gives a practice test a week before that helps a bit..  I'm not even sure how I passed.  At least he gives you full credit for showing up at lab.

Don't take him!!!!!! He is horrible.  He won't go over homework in class.  Says if you need help go to the SI session which is a student teaching.  His tests are impossible.  I was just glad to pass.  If you do bad on the first test drop it b/c it doesn't get any easier.

This professor is awful.  He will not answer questions in class.  He say just do the homework.  He thinks his test are very easy and there are extremely hard.  The class' average on test 2 was a 42 and he doesn't care if the whole class fails.  Bottom line, don't take his class if you want to achieve a C or better.

Horrible professor! He called the class stupid because the average on the test was a 47! Said we should change our majors...he also said he didn't care if the whole class failed because nothing would happen to him! tsc tsc HORRIBLE! Take Barker instead, he's the best according to my friends!

He knows the material very well, he just doesn't realize that we are students just learning the material. He moves at a very fast pace and you really don't have time to let the material sink in.  He's a nice guy and labs are so easy, but overall it's a tough class.
he is hard!!! ok the final exam was so tough. only his labs are easy..he teaches the material and wants everyone to pass the class but the class was hard for me.
